title: Program Manager, Vendor Quality Operations
description: A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in program or project management. Experience in agreement management and negotiation.
preferred_qualifications: Ability to work in a collaborative environment with program managers, data scientists, engineers, technical program managers, and external vendors. Ability to operate in a high-paced, changing work environment. Ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently, and navigate ambiguity. Excellent team player and people management skills. Excellent detail-oriented, problem-solving, and investigative skills.
responsibilities: Perform data analysis and execute data informed initiatives that will improve our internal stakeholder experience and drive business growth. Collaborate with Technical Program Managers, Product Managers, Engineers, Data Scientists, and work with a variety of internal/external, local/global stakeholders, share best practices, alignment of processes and prototyping of new initiatives. Work as a member of a team, collaborating closely together and help out with operational tasks. Collaborate with vendors to define compliance expectations, build partnerships based on transparency and shared success.
